channel.title: International CES News
channel.description: Stay up-to-date on the latest developments for 2008 International CES attendees.

item.title: CES posts 12 percent attendance growth
item.description: Independent audit verifies more than 126,000 industry professionals at the 2010 CES.

item.title: AHAM and CES join forces to showcase smart appliances in Connected Home Appliances TechZone
item.description: The Consumer Electronics Association (CEA)® today announced the launch of the Connected Home Appliances TechZone at the 2011 International CES, the world’s largest consumer technology tradeshow.

item.title: New Telecom Pavilion slated for 2011 to feature manufacturers of advanced broadband equipment
item.description: Global telecom buyers meet next generation broadband infrastructure solutions at 2011 CES

item.title: Hip, new hotel offers deep discounts for CEA Line Shows exhibitors
item.description: Located on 37th and Lexington Ave. in New York City, the hotel is nearby the June event.

item.title: Respected journalists, analysts and economists fill CEA Line Shows' speaker lineup
item.description: The New York City location and important mid-year timing are ideal for NYC-area media looking to experience the latest technology products to feature in summer vacation, back to school and holiday gift-giving previews.

item.title: CEA Line Shows, the CE industry’s official mid-year tech showcase, returns to N.Y.C. June 22
item.description: Attend manufacturer line shows for media and dealers, press conferences with key industry analysts and an innovation-focused conference program chaired by CBS/CNET correspondent Natali Del Conte.

item.title: 2011 CES iLOUNGE Pavilion doubles, will feature largest display of iPod, iPhone, iPad AND Mac products in CES history
item.description: Exhibit space expands for 2011 CES due to industry demand

item.title: For 2011, consider exhibiting in a TechZone
item.description: themed areas featuring hot products, technologies and solutions such green technologies, social media, mobile applications, iPhone, iPod and Mac-specific products, 3D displays, NetBooks, eBooks and other emerging technologies.

item.title: Panasonic 3D HDTV wins CNET Best of CES
item.description: CNET's expert editors hit the deck running at the 2010 International CES to find the best, new products.

item.title: CEA's Shapiro says CE industry will return to revenue growth in 2010
item.description: At 2010 CES, Shapiro speaks passionately about the need for innovation to drive the economy forward through its positive impact on consumers' lives.

item.title: Avoid airport delays with Bags to Go
item.description: If you are flying Delta, Frontier, Southwest Airlines, United Airlines, or US Airways, Bags to Go is a convenient service that has been implemented at The Venetian, the Luxor hotel and the Las Vegas Convention Center (LVCC).

item.title: Vegas properties offer discounts and coupons to CES attendees
item.description: Looking for a deal on a Vegas show? Want that all-you-can-eat buffet at half the price? Here you go.

item.title: Head to the Tempo Lounge at Hilton for CES Tweetup Friday Night
item.description: International CES Twitter followers are invited to meet the CEA Social Media Team and other members of our online community at the Official CES Tweetup, hosted by the Las Vegas Hilton.

item.title: Emmy Awards Tonight at CES
item.description: The National Academy of Television Arts and Sciences (NATAS) has presented the Emmy (r) Awards for Outstanding Achievement in Engineering /Technical Development since 1948. For the fourth year, the Awards will be presented at the International CES.

item.title: CES TechZones: See What is Driving the Digital Economy
item.description: Located throughout the entire CES show floor, TechZones are popular, themed areas that draw you in and surround you with emerging products.

item.title: 2010 CES features record 300 new exhibitors as world's largest consumer tech tradeshow
In-vehicle technology revs up for the 2010 CES
item.description: CES, the world's largest consumer technology tradeshow, will showcase the latest in-vehicle technology, including an opening keynote by Ford president and chief executive officer, Alan Mulally, with the 2010 Ford Taurus as the show's official car.

item.title: CES renews commitment to be world's largest environmentally friendly tradeshow
item.description: Partners with EarthEra to offset emissions from show facilities; donates electric vehicles to Las Vegas police.

item.title: SuperSessions feature FCC chairman, technology leaders and top retail executives
item.description: CES conference sessions to address technology policy, the global retail market, safe driving and future innovation.

item.title: New conference programs and exhibits added for content executives
item.description: The 2010 International CES is rolling out an expanded lineup of entertainment technology attractions to address growing demand from Hollywood and the content community for exhibits, conference sessions and more.

item.title: West Coast tech companies have big presence at upcoming CES
item.description: Nearly 600 West Coast US-based companies to exhibit CES in Las Vegas this January.

item.title: A New Place to Eat and Meet: Bistro CES
item.description: Bistro CES provides an excellent opportunity for uninterrupted, face-to-face time with your customers and business colleagues coupled with a private, well-catered dining experience right on the show floor.

item.title: International Technology Companies Bring Worldwide Focus to the 2010 CES
item.description: More than 950 international exhibitors participating in the world's largest consumer technology tradeshow.

item.title: Sustainable Planet: Technology that literally changes the world
item.description: The Susainable Planet CE Spotlight at the upcoming 2010 CES serves as the premier location for world-changing technologies, whether benefiting the environment, utilizing new forms of sustainable energy and renewing our resources.

item.title: “Into Tomorrow” was born at CES!
item.description: Fifteen years ago, the nationally syndicated consumer electronics radio show “Into Tomorrow with Dave Graveline” made their very first broadcast from the International CES.

item.title: CES Exhibitor video competition, Visit Me at CES, extended to Nov. 20
item.description: Win a month's worth of free exposure on CESweb.org.

item.title: Best of Innovations 2010 Design and Engineering Honorees announced
item.description: The Best of Innovations awards are given to the most honored products across 36 different categories, including the new software and online content categories of: electronic gaming software, online audio/video content delivery, online retail and more.

item.title: New partners and tracks featured in 2010 CES session lineup
item.description: The CES conference program unites the industry's most respected experts with conference sessions that address the latest trends, strategies and profit opportunities in consumer technology.

item.title: i-stage winner ReNu Solar Energy System awarded $40K and 2010 CES booth
item.description: Eleven finalists unveiled their products before a live audience at CEA's 2009 Industry Forum, in Phoenix, Arizona.

item.title: PC Gaming Alliance and Lego Universe to showcase the latest in gaming technologies at 2010 CES
item.description: The 2010 International CES will feature the latest in gaming hardware and software in the largest Gaming Showcase in CES history.

item.title: Free CES registration extended until October 7
item.description: To accommodate everyone who wants to attend what promises to be the largest and most innovative consumer electronics tradeshow in the world, CES extends free registration deadline.

item.title: Hisense chairman to deliver keynote address at 2010 CES
item.description: Keynote demonstrates CES' strength as the top event for global companies.

item.title: eBooks TechZone sells out, additional space added to meet customer demand
item.description: Entourage Systems, Freescale, Interead and Shortcovers to display latest eBook technologies at 2010 CES.

item.title: Entries open for Innovations 2010, honoring best in consumer electronics design and engineering
item.description: CEA Calls for Entries runs August 24 through September 25.

item.title: 2010 CES puts spotlight on Digital Imaging Showcase
item.description: 2010 CES to Include ATP, Kodak, Iomega, Tiffen, Wacom and Wynit.

item.title: Living in Digital Times to highlight technology innovations for all ages
item.description: Living in Digital Times, a new spotlight at the 2010 International CES, focuses on technology's impact on consumer lifestyles, from tech-savvy youth to digital moms to seniors.

item.title: Top Intel and MIcrosoft execs to keynote 2010 CES
item.description: Microsoft's Steve Ballmer and Intel's Paul Otellini to speak at world's largest consumer technology tradeshow

item.title: Final Week to Enter i-stage for a Chance at $50,000 and Booth at CES
item.description: Think you've got America's next top gadget, app or service? Prove it by 5 p.m. EDT this Friday, August 14, for a chance at $50,000 in prize money and a free booth at the 2010 International CES.

item.title: Exhibit space still available in EHX@CES show floor area
item.description: New for 2010, EHX@CES is powered by CE Pro to bring the EHX experience of a dedicated custom electronic exhibition to CES.

item.title: CES Brings in Some of the Most Influential Leaders in Consumer Electronics
item.description: Every January, Vegas plays host to the International CES and the 100,000+ attendees and exhibitors that it brings in. However, who exactly is attending CES with buying power?

item.title: The Association Behind the Show Launches New Grass-Roots Movement
item.description: Innovation Movement unites industry professionals, entrepreneurs and all Americans who believe innovation will promote American global leadership and economic recovery and growth.

item.title: Green is the New Black and Other Top Trends for 2010 CES
item.description: Here’s a quick shot at what developments playing out at CES 2010 might emerge as game changers in the years to come.

item.title: To Exhibit or Not to Exhibit During a Recession: Use Numbers to Help You Decide
item.description: CEA Marketing Vice President Susan Littleton shares her thoughts about why exhibiting at tradeshows is valuable during a recession.

item.title: Secure Your Travel Visa Now
item.description: Wait times for a visa interview can be several weeks or more in many countries, especially during peak travel periods.

item.title: CEA to Co-produce the International Forum on Sustainability of Consumer Electronics at SINOCES
item.description: E-waste and sustainability experts convene at China's most important consumer technology event this July.

item.title: Official CES Hotels Now Accepting Reservations for 2010 Show
item.description: The only thing more important than registering for CES is booking hotel accommodations for CES.

item.title: Reach More CE Pros Through the Combined Power of EHX and CES
item.description: Exhibiting opportunities are available at the first annual EHX@CES taking place in conjunction with the 2010 CES.

item.title: Aneesh Chopra, U.S. Chief Technology Officer, to Keynote CEA Line Shows
CEA Line Shows Just Days Away
item.description: If consumer electronics is your business, then register to attend CEA Line Shows, June 10-11.

item.title: Do You Have the Formula for Success on the i-stage?
item.description: i-stage is the proving ground for next-gen technologies – a chance for the hottest up-and-coming products, coolest services and killer applications to show off their selling points and duke it out to become the most promising powerhouse.

item.title: Women and Tech Awards, Panel and Reception at CEA Line Shows, June 11
item.description: Sessions unveil the best tech products for women.

item.title: 2009 SINOCES Hosts International CES' Best of Innovations Product Showcase
item.description: SINOCES attendees get the only opportunity outside the U.S. to see CES Innovations.

item.title: CEA President Says on CNN.com: The Next Generation Won't Have a Bill Gates
item.description: CEA President and CEO Gary Shapiro provides CNN.com commentary on how the government has been rushing to bail out failing companies.

item.title: New Customs Regulation Rule Affects CES Exhibitors
item.description: New U.S. Customs regulation for ocean freight shipped to the U.S. in place for 2010 International CES shipments.
